data.meta_description: Imam-ul-Haq is a Pakistani international cricketer who plays for the Pakistan National Cricket Team. In his first One Day International (ODI), against Sri Lanka, he became the second batter for Pakistan, and thirteenth overall, to score a century on debut. In August 2018, he was one of 33 players to be awarded a central contract for the 2018–19 season by the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB).
data.text:
Imam-ul-Haq

Pakistani cricketer (born 1995) / From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Dear Wikiwand AI, let's keep it short by simply answering these key questions:

Can you list the top facts and stats about Imam-ul-Haq?

Summarize this article for a 10 year old

SHOW ALL QUESTIONS

Imam-ul-Haq[lower-alpha 1] (pronounced [ɪmaːm ʊl ɦəq]; born 22 December 1995)[4] is a Pakistani international cricketer who plays for the Pakistan National Cricket Team.[5] In his first One Day International (ODI), against Sri Lanka, he became the second batter for Pakistan, and thirteenth overall, to score a century on debut.[6][7] In August 2018, he was one of 33 players to be awarded a central contract for the 2018–19 season by the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB).[8][9]
